_header: Whilom there was dwelling in Lombardy
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Merchant’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 1174 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whilom ther was dwellyng in lumbardyea worthi knyght that born was
                    in Pavie…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…thus endith here my tale of Ianuariegod bless vs and his
                    moder seynt Marie Amen
BodArcSelB14.Note:
IV.1816 omitted; spurious line follow 1818; 1778 written over
                    erasure.
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…and / next folwith his tale of Ianuarie and May (f. 115); the
                    Marchaunt (RT); Here endith the Marchauntis tale of Ianuarie / and May…
                    (f. 131)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whilom þer was dwellyng in lombardyeA worthi knyght þat
                    born was at pauye…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…God blesse vs and his moder seint marieOwre Ost gan tho to
                    loke vp anoonGode men quod he herkenyth euerychonAs euere mote I
                    drynke wyn or aleThis marchant hath I told a mery taleHow Ianuarie
                    hade a lether IapeHis wif put in his hoode an apeBut here of I wil
                    leue of as noweDame wif of Bath quod he I pray ȝowTelle vs a tale
                    now next after þisSir ost quod she so god my soule blisAs I fully
                    þerto wil consentAnd fully it is myn holly ententeTo do ȝow
                    alle disport þat I canBut holdith me excusid I am a womanI con
                    not rehersen as þise clerkes canAnd right anoon she hath hir tale
                    bygune
BodBar20.Note:
IV.1283, 2536 omitted; 2309-10 reversed; followed by the spurious,
                    sixteen-line ‘Merchant-Wife of Bath Link’ (see above).

Bod686.First Lines:
Whilom þer was dwellyng in lumbardyA worthy knyght þat
                    boren was of payuy…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth here my tale of IanuaryeGod blesse vs and his
                    moder seynt marie
Bod686.Note:
IV.2280 omitted; 2288 follows 2279 and recurs in its proper
                    place.
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth hys tale (f. 114v); Marchaunt (RT);
                    Here endeth the Merchaunts tale of Ianuarie… (f. 129)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
…On brutel gronde þei bilde brutelnesseÞei finde
                    whenne þei wene sikernesse…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Thus endeþ here my tale of IanuarieGod blesse vs and his
                    moder seint Marie Amen
BodLauMis600.Note:
IV.1245-78 lost (resupplied on a seventeenth-century leaf, f. 143);
                    1528, 1646, 1777, 1816, 1927-8, 2356 omitted; 2089-90 reversed.
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
þe marchaunt (RT); HEre endeþ þe tale of þe
                    Marchaunt… (f. 161)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[W]Hylom ther was dwellyng in LombardyA worthy knyght that born as
                    at pavy…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Thus endith here my tale of IanuarieGod blisse vs and his
                    moder seint marieOure oost gan tho to loke vp anoneGoode men quod he
                    herkeneth euerychonAs euere mote I drinke wyne or aleThis merchaunt
                    hath y tolde a mery taleHow Ianuarie hadde a lither IapeHis wiffe put
                    in his hoode an apeBut hereof will I leve of as nowDame Wyfe of Bath
                    quod he I pray ȝowTelle vs a tale now next after thisSir oost
                    quod she so god my soule blisseAs I fully þereto will consenteAnd
                    also it is myn hole ententeTo done ȝow all disport as þat I
                    kanBut holde me excusid I am a womanI can not reherse as these clerkis
                    kuneAnd right anone she hath hir tale bygune
BodLauMis739.Note:
IV.1424, 1528, 1646, 1777, 2356 omitted; spurious lines follow 1778,
                    1818; 2089-90 reversed; followed by the spurious, sixteen-line
                    ‘Merchant-Wife of Bath Link’ (see above).

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
Whilom ther was dwellyng in lumbardieA worthi knight that was borne
                    in pavy…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…To visite Damyan gothe MayAnd softli doune this lettre she
                    thriste…
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
The tale of the marchaunt / of Ianuarij and May (f. 45); the marchaunt
                    (RT)

CULGg427.First Lines:
…That in this world it is a paradysThus seyde this olde
                    knyght þat was so wys…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…ffyrst whan his syȝte is come newe a geynAs he that hath
                    a day or too Iseyn…

                    Here endith the Marchaunte his tale… (f. 77)

HunEL26C9.First Lines:
Whilom ther was dwellynge in lumbardyeA worthy knyght þat born
                    was of Pavye…
HunEL26C9.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth heere my tale of IanuarieBod blesse vs
                    and his mooder seinte Marie
HunEL26C9.Attributed Title:
Heere bigynneth the Marchantes tale (f. 102v); Marchant (RT);
                    Heere is ended the Marchantes tale of Ianuarie… (f. 115)

BNangl39.First Lines:
Uhilom ther was dwellyng in lumbardya wurthi knyght that was of
                    Pauy…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…thus endid is my tale of Ianuarygod blisse vs and his modir
                    seynt Mary
BNangl39.Note:
IV.2004-5, 2341-4 omitted; 1959-60 reversed; spurious lines follow 2103,
                    2104, 2126.
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
…& subsequenter narrat fabulam su / am hoc modo sequente &
                        cetera (f. 50va); Explicit fabula Mercatoris…
                    (f. 56vb)

TokyoTak24.First Lines:
Whilom ther was duelling in LumbardieA worthi kniȝt þat
                    born was of Pauye…
TokyoTak24.Last Lines:
…Thus endeth hiere my tale of IanuarieGod blisse vs alle and
                    oure lady Seint Marie
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:
…Et Incipit fabula sua / de Ianuario & Mayo (f.
                        115v); ffabula Mercatoris de Ianuarie May (RT); Hic
                        desinit fabula Mercatoris… (f. 130)

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
Whilume ther was dwellynge in lombardieA worthy knyght that born
                    was in pavie…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…Thus endyht here my tale of IanuarieGod blesse vs & his
                    moder seynt Marie
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here be gynnyht the Marchantis (f. 55vb); Marchaunt
                    (RT)
